info.title: The Horse & Jockey
info.address: Horse & Jockey, Gravel Ln, Wilmslow SK9 6EG

data.text: Just went for drinks with a few friends.
data.name: kay glynn

data.text: Lovely atmosphere, great food ,fantastic staff
data.name: wayne morrell
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Wayne.  It's you the guest who makes the atmosphere

data.text: Called in for a quick drink on a winter evening. Friendly staff and good real ale. Comfortable interior. A good 'local" pub.
data.name: Pete A

data.text: A clean and cosy pub. Dogs allowed, 2 real ales usually TT Landlord + 1, average prices. Worth a visit.
data.name: Ian Hunter

data.text: Really well kept beer. Worth a trip from out of the area
data.name: Colin Jones

data.text: Lovely traditional looking pub with a great pint of Guinness.
data.name: Les Windeler

data.text: Good beer garden.
data.name: Claire Rawji
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Claire.  Work in progress but we are happy so far.

data.name: Mike Tucker
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Mike.  We are working on that fifth star

data.text: Friendly pub
data.name: Kate Hodge

data.text: Fantastic hog roast on bank holiday. Home made cakes, brownies n dog biscuits. Seriously superior service, warm friendly welcome. Nothing too much trouble
data.name: Sue Dean

data.text: we went especially for the Hog roast seen advertised but was very disappointed, the meat was very fatty and not cooked how we would of preferred it.  We were also expecting more of a fun atmosphere. A Cute little local pub though which you can tell draws in local regulars. Staff were very friendly
data.name: Julie Berrington
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Not sure how to reply to this Julie.  The general consensus was the hog roast was delicious.  I love it which is why I keep booking it. Pork cooked in this style comes with an element of fat which is where the flavour comes from. You could have had a piece from the converted belly pork which can be very fatty.
As for fun you have to bring that with you.  We find that the big roast is a great excuse for family and friends to get together and usually there is a bit of serendipity and old friends can be bumped into.

data.text: Friendly staff nice old building üëç
data.name: Nigel Matthews
data.responseFromOwnerText: Or as we prefer nice old staff and friendly building

data.text: Great pub, nice cosy atmosphere, good choice of drinks & food..
data.name: David Fallows

data.text: First visit. Very friendly. Was even greeted by the dog
data.name: Roy
data.responseFromOwnerText: Ahh that our Libby, thinks everyone comes just to see her.  The diva

data.text: Nice place
data.name: Craig Keith Gagon

data.text: Nice friendly pub on a quiet road, everyone was cheery enough, although it helped being Christmas Day. Would visit again.
data.name: Nick Redfearn

data.text: Been visiting this pub on and off for the last 50 years, or so. Great local pub, always offers a warm and friendly welcome.
data.name: Rob Dooley

data.text: Great local.
data.name: David Hollick

data.text: Nice pub. Good beer garden with plenty of outdoor tables. Tidy, well furnished bar and clean toilets. Kids seem welcome
data.name: Richard Harrison

data.text: Great local pub
data.name: Ian Williams

data.text: Nice staffs and service!
data.name: Tek Bit

data.text: Very nice and so was your dog libby will see you again Yvonne  steve  x
data.name: Stephen Dooley

data.text: Amazing as always
data.name: Molly May

data.text:
Rang up to book and the manager who I presumed I was speaking to was so rude and arrogant. Definitely wouldn't advise going here! Not welcoming in the slightest. Stay away

Also more than happy for you to pass my name on. You can paint yourself out to be nicer than you was but you were rude and had no customer service skills what so ever. I definitely wouldn't go anywhere that treats people the way you did over phone.
data.name: Luke Bradley
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Wasn't rude, just pointed out although I don't take bookings I will look after my locals who have watched every match so far, which is fair! When you didn't get what you wanted you told me to f&ck o¬£¬£.  Glad you aren't coming son.
Thanks for the name I‚Äôll pass it around the other pubs as I don't think they‚Äôd like your company either.

data.text: Food no good
data.name: Surinder Mediratta
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Surinder.  I think you may be lost.
Firstly we don't serve food.
Secondly I have looked at your profile and we haven't served you.
Perhaps you have mixed us up with another pub or something more sinister.
Please remove this review as we are hard working folk who do not need this.

data.text: nice and cozy
data.name: P B Rad

data.text: Really well run - no worries at all in these socially distant times üòÄ
data.name: Tim Hepworth

data.text: Great place for a pint with your pooch!!üê∂üçª
data.name: Sharon Harrison

data.text: Excellent service, safe and easy to do.
data.name: Robert Lancaster

data.text: Other places were overcrowded and we didn't feel safe. The Horse and Jockey manage Covid19 perfectly and you feel really protected. The staff are brilliant and the prices reasonable.
data.name: Phil Barton

data.text: My wife booked a dinner at specific time.. apparently they have not updated their own website to stop booking dinners. The manager apologized..but date night was saved by ordering take away.
data.name: Ivan B
Ben Nicholson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Ben.  Great to look after you today

data.text: Lovely boozer, good atmosphere and full of friendly faces.
data.name: Jo Baker

data.text: Food was poor, had to complain as the meat was under cooked.
data.name: Stuart Shand
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Stuart.  We've been now closed for over 70 days because of a worldwide pandemic. You might have noticed or maybe not. I can only assume this visit was before that, literally months ago, could even be years, maybe before we took over. Is it even the right pub?

What is surprising is the timing of this review. Pubs are on their knees struggling to stay alive, frightened of the future, fighting pub companies and landlords and what we don't need is an out of date review.

Out of touch more like.

At times like this I like to look at other comments and feedback given to other business.  Interesting reading. Have a great day. Keep smiling!

data.text: Good beer and friendly staff and clientele. Good for. Kids and dogs, beer and fires.
data.name: David Morris

data.text: My local pub. Not cheap but decent beer and well decked out. Walkable to centre of Wilmslow.
data.name: chris walker

data.text: No bottles of peroni
data.name: Ian Swindells
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Ian

I know you love your Peroni but seeing as we have Peroni on draught now, bottles would be overkill.
We do, as you well know, have other premium bottles available such as San Miguel, Heineken Export, Modello, Estrella etc

data.text: I have started coming here lately, and the staff are really friendly and welcoming especially one in particular Chloe, she always lifts my mood. They do a mean pork pie I would recommend that if you come here, they are really addictive so be careful haha.. Atmosphere is calm and relaxing and I would recommend coming here :), Charlie is a big fan of the pork pies too!
data.name: John Junior

data.text: Old fashioned
data.name: Ronald Judge
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Yeah you are probably right Ronald! But we prefer the term traditional!
We are a family run business with a warm welcome, cold lagers, Cask Marque accredited and award winning cask ales, a good wine list, over 30 gins, homemade food, quiz night, dominoes night, a couple of log fires, Lavazza coffee, dog bowls and treats but hey, with no sport or Discos it‚Äôs not for everyone.

data.text: Awesome pub to go with the family.
data.name: Erika Zimmermann
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thanks Erika

Just as good when you leave them at home!üòâ

Paul

data.text: Good local pub.
data.name: Chris 71
Alastair Warwick
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hey Alastair

Thanks for the review

data.text: Nice pub and atmosphere
data.name: Barry
Tony Maddox
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Tony, Tony, Tony.

What do we need to get that last star?
Bit of Northern Soul?  Well perhaps that's an idea! üòÅüéµüï∫

data.text: Always a nice pint, friendly staff and clean.
data.name: James Russell

data.text: Actually went to my home of 132 Gravel Lane where I lived from age of 1 to 21
data.name: Richard Parker
data.responseFromOwnerText: So you gave your old house 5 stars?   We‚Äôll take it

data.text: Good range of drinks. Friendly pub.
data.name: Chritopher Teal

data.text: What a fabulous place for a pint or some lovely food !! A real gem hidden away ..
data.name: Daniel Jones

data.text: Great local pub.
data.name: James coppock

data.text: Family friendly and cosy atmosphere...very clean too!
data.name: Sharon Ponder

data.text: Very friendly warm atmosphere
data.name: Brian Murray

data.text: Good pint
data.name: pug life

data.text:
Good local with a pretty decent range of wines and really friendly staff.
Dogs welcome.
Car park limited but never too busy.
Outdoor space is great.
data.name: Rachel C
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you Rachel.

We jokingly say we welcome well-behaved kids, dogs & drunks

data.text: Excellent,nice and relaxed ,good back ground music
data.name: Clive Rotherham

data.text: Nice pub. Visited for a catch up with friends. The bartender was unresponsive, felt a bit let down on the way my order was handled. Would have been a 5 otherwise.
data.name: Vaitheesh. Subramanyam
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Vaitheesh.

Thanks for the review.  How do we get the 5th star?

data.text: Awful food.... the cheapest fish fingers and evidence of being fried in dirty fat. I will not be taking my kids for tea there again! Such a shame as after the original re-furb the food was quite nice.
data.name: Sarah Dynes
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Sarah.

I am truly sorry for your experience. It' sounds like we got it wrong here and I‚Äôd love to learn more, if you‚Äôd be good enough to email me with further details at paul@thejockey.pub

It is very unlike us as you can see from all the other scores and comments, on here and the other review sites.  I think my wife's cooking is growing quite a reputation for being simple but fresh food, delivered at a very reasonable price.

We gained a 5üåü rating from the EHO just a couple of months ago.

data.text: Seems much improved with the new owners. Will have to give them a try for a meal sometime.
data.name: Jane Wass
data.responseFromOwnerText: Come Jane! We are waiting to spoil you!

data.name: Tim Greening-Jackson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Tim.  Thanks for the review.  How do we get that last star?

data.text: What a perfect Christmas lunch served to us by the lovely bunch at horse and jockey! Our tables were set so festively...even including a  christmas-cracker dog chew for all the dogs!!
data.name: Mia De Klerk
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Mia. Great to look after you again!

data.text: Handforth
data.name: Thomas Wilson
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Thomas. What do we need to do to get that extra star?

data.name: James Widnall
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hey James... What happened? Let us know paul@thejockey.pub

data.text: What a lovely little find. Great local family pub. Children, dogs and wives welcome. Hahaha. Paul and Paula are great hosts. Good cask ale, good pork pies and amazing coffee. Proper pub for nice people
data.name: Jason Jennings
data.responseFromOwnerText: Ta Jason. Great to look after you

data.text: Nice local
data.name: Andy Webb
data.responseFromOwnerText: Cheers Andy. How do we get that extra star?

data.text: Lovely place. Very welcoming
data.name: Dave C Roberts

data.text: Very pleasant, lovely roaring fire every one very helpful and pleasant. They also have a nice food menu, basic but nice will be giving the food a go
data.name: Wendy Macdonald

data.text: Our first visit for long time, a little disappointed. A very short and basic menu and no veg. Pate not available at 7pm on a Saturday night. Service also basic.
data.name: Donald Alderson
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Donald

I can see from your other reviews that you are not an unreasonable reviewer.

I also love going to see Ann at The Swan with Two Nicks and Jeremy at The Egerton, but they run pub restaurants, with waiters and waitresses, brigades of chefs and large menus.

We, my friend, are a local pub, where I pour the drinks and my wife makes the food. Your review and comments don't take this into account, so you are bound to score us poorly in comparison! I can see you were tech savvy enough to book online, so our menu was available to you before you came, if you‚Äôd care to look.

We serve a simple yet fairly fresh menu of 10 main courses, mostly pub classics, all under ¬£10, alongside a great selection of hot and cold sandwiches too. Hardly a small menu especially if you‚Äôd taken into account that my wife makes much from scratch including ...
Soup
Steak and ale pie including the pastry
Lasagna (both traditional and vegetarian)
Chili con carne (traditional and veg)
All mash and gravy
The best apple crumble.

Where we don't make it ourselves, we source the produce from our friends at The Cheshire Butcher and Farmshop including...
Protein - chicken, ham, bacon, beef, steak, mince,
Dairy - eggs, butter, milk, cheese, cream
Fruit and Veg - potatoes, apples, lemons,
Other - pate, pork pies, ice cream, chutneys.

We‚Äôd love to have you back but don't be so harsh next time. Give us another try when you can't be bothered to cook but fancy a home cooked meal.

Give Ann & Jeremy our best!

data.name: sean cotton
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks Sean. How do we get that final star?

data.name: Marky Ads
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Mark.

Can we have more details to paul@thejockey.pub please?

Paul

data.text:
Wonderful pub.
Great team
Great atmosphere
Great food
data.name: Eric Howe

data.text: Real community pub
data.name: Mike thetenantsfriend

data.text: Really friendly landlord, cosy atmosphere, good choice of wine and gin. Had a pop up hog roast bank holiday Sunday, it was fantastic! I believe they are going to do this every bank holiday Sunday! Massive thumbs up...
data.name: Philip Jamieson

data.text: Pleasant seating area outside with fresh cooked good food servedby  Friendly staff.
data.name: L One
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Sarah.  We are so glad you are enjoying what we are trying to do with the place.

data.text: At last; a proper pub!
data.name: John Rees
data.responseFromOwnerText: Yes John!  a pub for all the community.

data.text:
Great new landlord and landlady met some great people. Have had Sunday lunch a couple of times now would recommend a try.
Very warm and friendly place.
As myself and husband have just moved into the area we've been made very welcome.
It is also child friendly my grandchildren love going when they come to visit.
Great job Paul
data.name: Amanda Boyle

data.text: lovely pub, really friendly service we'll be back to sample the Sunday roast
data.name: Victoria Kinsella

data.text: Great hosts and plans for a real community village focal point with great beer food and the best tasting coffee from Italy.
data.name: Scott Johnson
Martin Bulman
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hey Martin.  Can we have some more details?

data.name: Jack Bentley
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Jack. can we have some more details?

data.text: Excellent beer
data.name: Richard Flanagan

data.text: Greatvpub good beer new manager food in January Carol service Christmas eve 5ish
data.name: John Martin
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks John.  But new owners not new managers.

data.text: The food was expensive
data.name: Dave Downes
data.responseFromOwnerText: before our time.  Try now as all main meals under ¬£10

data.text: Good lunchtime pint away from the noise of the town
data.name: James Morphet

data.text: Food was ok but pricey for what you got
data.name: Chris S
data.responseFromOwnerText: Give it another go.  All meals under ¬£10!

data.text: Cozy friendly local pub . Good new chef
data.name: Matt Boyns
